chapter.pericope: Lament for the Leaders of Israel
chapter.p: 1“And you, raise a lament aboutOr “over” the leaders of Israel, 2and you must say,

ul.li1: ‘What a lioness was your mother
She lay down in the midst of young lions,
ul.li2: and she reared her lion cubs.
ul.li1: 3And she raised up one from her cubs;
and he learned to tear prey;
4And nations heard about him;
ul.li2: in their pit he was caught,
ul.li1: and they brought him with hooks
5And she sawOr “realized” that she was waiting in vain;
and she took one from her cubs,
ul.li2: and she made him a fierce lion.
ul.li1: 6And he walked about in the midst of lions;
and he learned to tear prey;
7And he knew their widows,Or “ravished/raped”; or “he ravaged their strongholds”
and the land was appalled, and everyone in itLiterally “its fullness”
ul.li2: at the sound of his roar.
ul.li1: 8And nations set out against him
ul.li2: from the surrounding provinces,Literally “all around from the provinces”
ul.li1: and they spread their net over him,
ul.li2: and he was caught in their pit.
ul.li1: 9And they put him in a collar with hooks,
ul.li2: and they brought him to the king of Babylon;
they brought him intoHebrew “in” a prison,
ul.li1: so that his voice would not be heard any longerLiterally “longer”
10Your mother was like the vine in your vineyard;Or “in the vineyard”
and it was full of branches
11And she produced branches of strengthLiterally “they became to her branches/rods of strength”
its height became tall
and it was seenOr “visible” because of its tallness
ul.li2: among the abundance of its branches.
ul.li1: 12But it was uprooted in rage;
ul.li2: it was thrown to the earth,
ul.li1: and the east wind dried up its fruit;
and its strong branch dried up;
13And now it is planted in the desert,
ul.li2: in a dry and thirsty land.Literally “a land of dryness and thirst”
ul.li1: 14And so fire has gone out from the stem of its branches;
and there was not in it a strong branch,Literally “a branch of strength”

chapter.p: This is a lament, and it will be used as a lament.Literally “she is for a lament”
